intro: Bombacopsis pachiroides, commonly known as the Malabar chestnut, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
